org.sdsu.intelligrid.graphics.ui

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClickableSprite

        public ClickableSprite(Vector2f location,
               float rotation,
               Vector2f scale,
               Color color,
               int resource,
               Vector2f boundLL,
               Vector2f boundUR,
               java.lang.String id,
               int depth)
        A Class that extends Sprite with Clickable capabilities.

        The dimensions are in openGL coordinates, so bounds of [-0.1,-0.1] to [0.1,0.1] defines a clickable 160-pixel square (on our device) centered on the object.

        Parameters:
        location - the location of the sprite, in OpenGL coordinates ( [0.0,0.0] is the default position)
        rotation - the rotation of the sprite, in radians (0.0 means it is facing in the default direction)
        scale - the scale of the sprite ([1.0,1.0] is the default scale)
        color - the color factor of the sprite
        resource - the resource ID that the sprite should display (make sure it has been already loaded with MainRenderer#loadTextures(resources))
        boundLL - the lower left bounds of the clickable object, where [0,0] is the center of the object
        boundUR - the upper right bounds of the clickable object, where [0,0] is the center of the object
        id - the identifier for the clickable object
        depth - the interface depth for the clickable object

    • Method Detail

      • getBoundLL

        public Vector2f getBoundLL()
        Gets the clickable object's lower left corner of its clickable bounds.

        Clickable bounds do not respect sprite rotation or scale. If you rotate or scale the sprite, the bounds will NOT change.

        Specified by:
        getBoundLL in interface Clickable
        Returns:
        the clickable object's lower left bounds

      • getBoundUR

        public Vector2f getBoundUR()
        Gets the clickable object's upper right corner of its clickable bounds.

        Clickable bounds do not respect sprite rotation or scale. If you rotate or scale the sprite, the bounds will NOT change.

        Specified by:
        getBoundUR in interface Clickable
        Returns:
        the clickable object's upper right bounds

      • setBoundLL

        public void setBoundLL(Vector2f boundLL)
        Sets the clickable object's lower left corner of its clickable bounds.

        Clickable bounds do not respect sprite rotation or scale. If you rotate or scale the sprite, the bounds will NOT change.

        Parameters:
        boundLL - the lower left bounds to set for the clickable object

      • setBoundUR

        public void setBoundUR(Vector2f boundUR)
        Sets the clickable object's upper right corner of its clickable bounds.

        Clickable bounds do not respect sprite rotation or scale. If you rotate or scale the sprite, the bounds will NOT change.

        Parameters:
        boundUR - the upper right bounds to set for the clickable object

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Description copied from interface: Clickable
        Gets the clickable object's identifier. This is designed for internal use in InputHook, so you don't have to extend different classes for every single button.
        Specified by:
        getId in interface Clickable
        Returns:
        the clickable object's identifier

      • setId

        public void setId(java.lang.String id)
        Sets the clickable object's identifier. This is designed for internal use in InputHook, so you don't have to extend different classes for every single button.
        Parameters:
        id - the desired identifier for the clickable object

      • getDepth

        public int getDepth()
        Description copied from interface: Clickable
        Gets the clickable object's interface depth. A lower depth means the object's click priority is higher (reflecting a more frontward location on the screen).
        Specified by:
        getDepth in interface Clickable
        Returns:
        the clickable object's interface depth

      • setDepth

        public void setDepth(int depth)
        Sets the clickable object's interface depth. A lower depth means the object's click priority is higher (reflecting a more frontward location on the screen).
        Parameters:
        depth - the desired interface depth for clickable object
